summary: Simple to make Greybeard robes - previously unavailable to the player unless the console was used. No perks necessary.
descriptionHtml:
Updates:
1.2 - Fixed the issue where NPCs accuse the player of being naked. Turns out the robes are missing a piece of script that all other clothing has that lets the NPCs know that the user is wearing clothes. Neat. There\'s a \"Classic\" version for those who enjoy being accused of nudity...
1.1 - Fixed issues with hood not appearing in some players\' inventory
1.0 - Mod uploaded

Description:
Maybe it was just me, but I thought that the Greybeard robes were the coolest looking robes in the game. I was surprised that they were not available to obtain without the use of the console...

So, for my first mod, I decided to make these awesome robes craftable. This includes:
Greybeard\'s Hood - 1 Leather, 1 Leather Strip
Greybeard\'s Robes - 2 Leather, 4 Leather Strips
Greybeard\'s Boots - 1 Leather, 2 Leather Strips

No perks necessary, and as you can see, not very demanding material-wise. The only catch is that they aren\'t worth anything (other than their sentimental value!)

Manual Install:
Just unzip the folder into your data folder for the game, located here if using steam:
C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Steam\\steamapps\\common\\skyrim\\Data

Thanks to...
Bathesda for both Skyrim and the Creation Kit, without either of them this could have never happened
This user\'s video, which will help anyone interested in making a craftable item:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vPFwC4XFjBo
And you guys, for downloading, and to the bug finders out there (like Nexus user DarkGenius).
author: KillerSnowmanX
